citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live birds.
citations.narrative:
While participating in a recent adoption event, three transport enclosures housing two birds each did not have proper
labeling for live animals. One enclosure housed two zebra finches and two enclosures housed two parakeets each. All
birds that were present in the transport enclosures had pre-approved adoptions scheduled to occur at the event. The
transport containers lacked "Live Animal" stickers. Unless the enclosure is permanently affixed to the conveyance, it must
be clearly marked on top and on one or more sides with the words "Live Animals" in letters at least 1" high, and with
arrows or other markings to indicate the correct upright position of the primary enclosure. Proper labeling of transport
enclosures housing live animals helps to ensure that enclosures stay upright at all times for the safety and comfort of the
animals.
***Correct by 4/25/25
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.162(a)(6) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live birds. 
While participating in a recent adoption event, three transport enclosures housing two birds each did not have proper 
labeling for live animals. One enclosure housed two zebra finches and two enclosures housed two parakeets each. All 
birds that were present in the transport enclosures had pre-approved adoptions scheduled to occur at the event. The 
transport containers lacked "Live Animal" stickers. Unless the enclosure is permanently affixed to the conveyance, it must 
be clearly marked on top and on one or more sides with the words "Live Animals" in letters at least 1" high, and with 
arrows or other markings to indicate the correct upright position of the primary enclosure. Proper labeling of transport 
enclosures housing live animals helps to ensure that enclosures stay upright at all times for the safety and comfort of the 
animals.  
 
***Correct by 4/25/25 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
